item.title: How to Start a Successful Side Project
item.author: admin@andrewrgoss.com (Andrew Goss)
item.description:
This post originally appeared on Simple Programmer. written by Alexander Petkov View original article
Do you ever feel like you are confident in only one particular field? Like you know only one tiny corner of the vast software universe? Then, the minute you try to escape it and work on something different, you get frustrated. And if you need to build a complete, functional project—from scratch—with: Initial research and machine setup (packages, installments)Managing dependencies (libraries, build tools, automations)The whole business logic plus high test coverageProduction deployment … then somebody else has to do everything except the little corner of your comfort zone?
